hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd: Information reached me that Abu Said al-Khudri entered upon Marwan ibn al-Hakam, so Marwan said to him: Did you hear the Prophet ﷺ forbid breathing in drink? Abu Said said: Yes, and the Prophet ﷺ said: If you cannot satisfy yourself with one breath, remove the cup from your mouth then breathe. The man said: But I see sediment in it. The Prophet ﷺ said: Pour it out.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd: Information reached me from the Prophet ﷺ that he was brought a drink and drank from it. On his right was a young boy, and on his left were elderly companions. The Prophet ﷺ asked the boy: Do you permit me to give this to these elders? The boy said: No, by Allah, and I do not prefer anyone over you for myself. So the Prophet ﷺ placed it in the boy's hands.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd from Aisha: We presented haysa (a food preparation) to the Prophet ﷺ. [Also reported:] Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd said: Ibn al-Nu'man said: We departed with the Prophet ﷺ until we were at as-Sahba, which is from the nearest part of Khaybar. He prayed Asr and called for provisions, but nothing was brought except saweeq. He ordered it to be kneaded, and he ate and we ate. Then he stood for Maghrib, and we rinsed our mouths and he rinsed his mouth, then he prayed and did not perform ablution.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd: Information reached me from Jabir ibn Abdullah who said: The Prophet ﷺ sent forth an expedition and appointed Abu Ubaidah ibn al-Jarrah as our commander, and there were three hundred of us, and I was among them. We departed until when we were on the way, the provisions were exhausted. Abu Ubaidah ordered that the provisions of the army be gathered, and there were two leather bags of dates. He rationed for us each day little by little until it was exhausted, and we only received dates one by one. When they were exhausted, we reached the sea and found a large fish like a mountain. The army ate from it for eighteen nights. Then Abu Ubaidah ordered two of its ribs to be set up, and he ordered his camel to be saddled, then he passed under them without touching them. Abu Ubaidah said: The Prophet ﷺ forbade three types of eating: peeling, taking handfuls of large amounts, and digging. The peeler is one who eats from every side and strips the surface of the food. The one who takes large handfuls is the one who takes mouthfuls beyond capacity. The digger is one who digs in the food and returns to the sauce.
